content: शूद्रः [शुच्-रक् पृषो° चस्य दः दीर्घः <ls>Uṇ. 2. 19</ls>] A man of the fourth or the last of the four principal tribes of the Hindus; he is said to have been born from the feet of {%Puruṣa%}; पद्भ्यां शूद्रो अजायत <ls>Rv. 10. 90. 12</ls>, or of Brahman; <ls>Ms. 1. 87</ls>, and his principal business was to serve the three higher castes; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 1. 91</ls>.
